trans-unit.source: Create and Manage Hybrid Connections | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Create and Manage Hybrid Connections | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to create a hybrid connection, manage the connection, and install the Hybrid Connection Manager.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to create a hybrid connection, manage the connection, and install the Hybrid Connection Manager.

trans-unit.source: MABS, WABS
trans-unit.target: MABS, WABS

trans-unit.source: Create and Manage Hybrid Connections
trans-unit.target: Create and Manage Hybrid Connections

trans-unit.source: Overview of the Steps
trans-unit.target: Overview of the Steps

trans-unit.source: Create a Hybrid Connection by entering the host name or IP address of the on-premises resource in your private network.
trans-unit.target: Create a Hybrid Connection by entering the host name or IP address of the on-premises resource in your private network.

trans-unit.source: Link your Azure Web Apps or Azure Mobile Apps to the Hybrid Connection.
trans-unit.target: Link your Azure Web Apps or Azure Mobile Apps to the Hybrid Connection.

trans-unit.source: Install the Hybrid Connection Manager on your on-premises resource and connect to the specific Hybrid Connection.
trans-unit.target: Install the Hybrid Connection Manager on your on-premises resource and connect to the specific Hybrid Connection.

trans-unit.source: The Azure portal provides a single-click experience to install and connect.
trans-unit.target: The Azure portal provides a single-click experience to install and connect.

trans-unit.source: Manage Hybrid Connections and their connection keys.
trans-unit.target: Manage Hybrid Connections and their connection keys.

trans-unit.source: This topic lists these steps.
trans-unit.target: This topic lists these steps.

trans-unit.source: Create a Hybrid Connection
trans-unit.target: Create a Hybrid Connection

trans-unit.source: A Hybrid Connection can be created in the Azure Management Portal using Web Apps **or** using BizTalk Services.
trans-unit.target: A Hybrid Connection can be created in the Azure Management Portal using Web Apps **or** using BizTalk Services.

trans-unit.source: **To create Hybrid Connections using Web Apps**, see [Connect Azure Web Apps to an On-Premises Resource](../web-sites-hybrid-connection-get-started.md).
trans-unit.target: **To create Hybrid Connections using Web Apps**, see [Connect Azure Web Apps to an On-Premises Resource](../web-sites-hybrid-connection-get-started.md).

trans-unit.source: **To create Hybrid Connections in BizTalk Services**:
trans-unit.target: **To create Hybrid Connections in BizTalk Services**:

trans-unit.source: Sign in to the [Azure Management Portal](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkID=213885).
trans-unit.target: Sign in to the [Azure Management Portal](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkID=213885).

trans-unit.source: In the left navigation pane, select **BizTalk Services** and then select your BizTalk Service.
trans-unit.target: In the left navigation pane, select **BizTalk Services** and then select your BizTalk Service.

trans-unit.source: If you don't have an existing BizTalk Service, you can [Create a BizTalk Service](biztalk-provision-services.md).
trans-unit.target: If you don't have an existing BizTalk Service, you can [Create a BizTalk Service](biztalk-provision-services.md).

trans-unit.source: Select the Hybrid Connections tab:
trans-unit.target: Select the Hybrid Connections tab:

trans-unit.source: Hybrid Connections Tab
trans-unit.target: Hybrid Connections Tab

trans-unit.source: Select **Create a Hybrid Connection** or select the **ADD** button in the task bar.
trans-unit.target: Select **Create a Hybrid Connection** or select the **ADD** button in the task bar.

trans-unit.source: Enter the following:
trans-unit.target: Enter the following:

trans-unit.source: Property | Description
trans-unit.target: Property | Description

trans-unit.source: Name | The Hybrid Connection name must be unique and cannot be the same name as the BizTalk Service.
trans-unit.target: Name | The Hybrid Connection name must be unique and cannot be the same name as the BizTalk Service.

trans-unit.source: You can enter any name but be specific with its purpose.
trans-unit.target: You can enter any name but be specific with its purpose.

trans-unit.source: Examples include:
trans-unit.target: Examples include:

trans-unit.source: Payroll*SQLServer*
trans-unit.target: Payroll*SQLServer*

trans-unit.source: SupplyList*SharepointServer*
trans-unit.target: SupplyList*SharepointServer*

trans-unit.source: Customers*OracleServer*
trans-unit.target: Customers*OracleServer*

trans-unit.source: Host Name | Enter the fully qualified host name, only the host name, or the IPv4 address of the on-premises resource.
trans-unit.target: Host Name | Enter the fully qualified host name, only the host name, or the IPv4 address of the on-premises resource.

trans-unit.source: Examples include:
trans-unit.target: Examples include:

trans-unit.source: mySQLServer
trans-unit.target: mySQLServer

trans-unit.source: *mySQLServer*.*Domain*.corp.*yourCompany*.com
trans-unit.target: *mySQLServer*.*Domain*.corp.*yourCompany*.com

trans-unit.source: *myHTTPSharePointServer*
trans-unit.target: *myHTTPSharePointServer*

trans-unit.source: *myHTTPSharePointServer*.*yourCompany*.com
trans-unit.target: *myHTTPSharePointServer*.*yourCompany*.com

trans-unit.source: Port | Enter the port number of the on-premises resource.
trans-unit.target: Port | Enter the port number of the on-premises resource.

trans-unit.source: For example, if you're using Web Apps, enter port 80 or port 443.
trans-unit.target: For example, if you're using Web Apps, enter port 80 or port 443.

trans-unit.source: If you're using SQL Server, enter port 1433.
trans-unit.target: If you're using SQL Server, enter port 1433.

trans-unit.source: Select the check mark to complete the setup.
trans-unit.target: Select the check mark to complete the setup.

trans-unit.source: Additional
trans-unit.target: Additional

trans-unit.source: Multiple Hybrid Connections can be created.
trans-unit.target: Multiple Hybrid Connections can be created.

trans-unit.source: See the [BizTalk Services: Editions Chart](biztalk-editions-feature-chart.md) for the number of connections allowed.
trans-unit.target: See the [BizTalk Services: Editions Chart](biztalk-editions-feature-chart.md) for the number of connections allowed.

trans-unit.source: Each Hybrid Connection is created with a pair of connection strings: Application keys that SEND and On-premises keys that LISTEN.
trans-unit.target: Each Hybrid Connection is created with a pair of connection strings: Application keys that SEND and On-premises keys that LISTEN.

trans-unit.source: Each pair has a Primary and a Secondary key.
trans-unit.target: Each pair has a Primary and a Secondary key.

trans-unit.source: Link your Azure Web Apps or Azure Mobile Apps
trans-unit.target: Link your Azure Web Apps or Azure Mobile Apps

trans-unit.source: To link the Azure Web Apps to an existing Hybrid Connection, select **use an existing Hybrid Connection** in the Hybrid Connections blade.
trans-unit.target: To link the Azure Web Apps to an existing Hybrid Connection, select **use an existing Hybrid Connection** in the Hybrid Connections blade.

trans-unit.source: See [Connect Azure Web Apps to an On-Premises Resource](../web-sites-hybrid-connection-get-started.md).
trans-unit.target: See [Connect Azure Web Apps to an On-Premises Resource](../web-sites-hybrid-connection-get-started.md).

trans-unit.source: To link the Azure Mobile Apps to an existing Hybrid Connection, select **add hybrid connection** when changing or creating a Mobile Service.
trans-unit.target: To link the Azure Mobile Apps to an existing Hybrid Connection, select **add hybrid connection** when changing or creating a Mobile Service.

trans-unit.source: See [Azure Mobile Services and Hybrid Connections](../mobile-services-dotnet-backend-hybrid-connections-get-started.md).
trans-unit.target: See [Azure Mobile Services and Hybrid Connections](../mobile-services-dotnet-backend-hybrid-connections-get-started.md).

trans-unit.source: Install the Hybrid Connection Manager on-premises
trans-unit.target: Install the Hybrid Connection Manager on-premises

trans-unit.source: After a Hybrid Connection is created, install the Hybrid Connection Manager on the on-premises resource.
trans-unit.target: After a Hybrid Connection is created, install the Hybrid Connection Manager on the on-premises resource.

trans-unit.source: It can be downloaded from your Azure Web Apps or from your BizTalk Service.
trans-unit.target: It can be downloaded from your Azure Web Apps or from your BizTalk Service.

trans-unit.source: BizTalk Services steps:
trans-unit.target: BizTalk Services steps:

trans-unit.source: Sign in to the [Azure Management Portal](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkID=213885).
trans-unit.target: Sign in to the [Azure Management Portal](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkID=213885).

trans-unit.source: In the left navigation pane, select **BizTalk Services** and then select your BizTalk Service.
trans-unit.target: In the left navigation pane, select **BizTalk Services** and then select your BizTalk Service.

trans-unit.source: Select the **Hybrid Connections** tab:
trans-unit.target: Select the **Hybrid Connections** tab:

trans-unit.source: ![Hybrid Connections Tab][HybridConnectionTab]
trans-unit.target: ![Hybrid Connections Tab][HybridConnectionTab]

trans-unit.source: In the task bar, select **On-Premises Setup**:
trans-unit.target: In the task bar, select **On-Premises Setup**:

trans-unit.source: ![On-Premises Setup][HCOnPremSetup]
trans-unit.target: ![On-Premises Setup][HCOnPremSetup]

trans-unit.source: Select **Install and Configure** to run or download the Hybrid Connection Manager on the on-premises system.
trans-unit.target: Select **Install and Configure** to run or download the Hybrid Connection Manager on the on-premises system.

trans-unit.source: Select the check mark to start the installation.
trans-unit.target: Select the check mark to start the installation.

trans-unit.source: Additional
trans-unit.target: Additional

trans-unit.source: Hybrid Connections support on-premises resources installed on the following operating systems:
trans-unit.target: Hybrid Connections support on-premises resources installed on the following operating systems:

trans-unit.source: Windows Server 2008 R2
trans-unit.target: Windows Server 2008 R2

trans-unit.source: Windows Server 2012
trans-unit.target: Windows Server 2012

trans-unit.source: Windows Server 2012 R2
trans-unit.target: Windows Server 2012 R2

trans-unit.source: After you install the Hybrid Connection Manager, the following occurs:
trans-unit.target: After you install the Hybrid Connection Manager, the following occurs:

trans-unit.source: The Hybrid Connection hosted on Azure is automatically configured to use the Primary Application Connection String.
trans-unit.target: The Hybrid Connection hosted on Azure is automatically configured to use the Primary Application Connection String.

trans-unit.source: The On-Premises resource is automatically configured to use the Primary On-Premises Connection String.
trans-unit.target: The On-Premises resource is automatically configured to use the Primary On-Premises Connection String.

trans-unit.source: The Hybrid Connection Manager must use a valid on-premises connection string for authorization.
trans-unit.target: The Hybrid Connection Manager must use a valid on-premises connection string for authorization.

trans-unit.source: The Azure Web Apps or Mobile Apps must use a valid application connection string for authorization.
trans-unit.target: The Azure Web Apps or Mobile Apps must use a valid application connection string for authorization.

trans-unit.source: You can scale Hybrid Connections by installing another instance of the Hybrid Connection Manager on another server.
trans-unit.target: You can scale Hybrid Connections by installing another instance of the Hybrid Connection Manager on another server.

trans-unit.source: Configure the on-premises listener to use the same address as the first on-premises listener.
trans-unit.target: Configure the on-premises listener to use the same address as the first on-premises listener.

trans-unit.source: In this situation, the traffic is randomly distributed (round robin) between the active on-premises listeners.
trans-unit.target: In this situation, the traffic is randomly distributed (round robin) between the active on-premises listeners.

trans-unit.source: Manage Hybrid Connections
trans-unit.target: Manage Hybrid Connections

trans-unit.source: To manage your Hybrid Connections, you can:
trans-unit.target: To manage your Hybrid Connections, you can:

trans-unit.source: Use the Azure portal and go to your BizTalk Service.
trans-unit.target: Use the Azure portal and go to your BizTalk Service.

trans-unit.source: Use [REST APIs](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn232347.aspx).
trans-unit.target: Use [REST APIs](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn232347.aspx).

trans-unit.source: Copy/regenerate the Hybrid Connection Strings
trans-unit.target: Copy/regenerate the Hybrid Connection Strings

trans-unit.source: Sign in to the [Azure Management Portal](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkID=213885).
trans-unit.target: Sign in to the [Azure Management Portal](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkID=213885).

trans-unit.source: In the left navigation pane, select **BizTalk Services** and then select your BizTalk Service.
trans-unit.target: In the left navigation pane, select **BizTalk Services** and then select your BizTalk Service.

trans-unit.source: Select the **Hybrid Connections** tab:
trans-unit.target: Select the **Hybrid Connections** tab:

trans-unit.source: ![Hybrid Connections Tab][HybridConnectionTab]
trans-unit.target: ![Hybrid Connections Tab][HybridConnectionTab]

trans-unit.source: Select the Hybrid Connection.
trans-unit.target: Select the Hybrid Connection.

trans-unit.source: In the task bar, select **Manage Connection**:
trans-unit.target: In the task bar, select **Manage Connection**:

trans-unit.source: ![Manage Options][HCManageConnection]
trans-unit.target: ![Manage Options][HCManageConnection]

trans-unit.source: **Manage Connection** lists the Application and On-Premises connection strings.
trans-unit.target: **Manage Connection** lists the Application and On-Premises connection strings.

trans-unit.source: You can copy the Connection Strings or regenerate the Access Key used in the connection string.
trans-unit.target: You can copy the Connection Strings or regenerate the Access Key used in the connection string.

trans-unit.source: **If you select Regenerate**, the Shared Access Key used within the Connection String is changed.
trans-unit.target: **If you select Regenerate**, the Shared Access Key used within the Connection String is changed.

trans-unit.source: Do the following:
trans-unit.target: Do the following:

trans-unit.source: In the Azure Management Portal, select **Sync Keys** in the Azure application.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure Management Portal, select **Sync Keys** in the Azure application.

trans-unit.source: Re-run the **On-Premises Setup**.
trans-unit.target: Re-run the **On-Premises Setup**.

trans-unit.source: When you re-run the On-Premises Setup, the on-premises resource is automatically configured to use the updated Primary connection string.
trans-unit.target: When you re-run the On-Premises Setup, the on-premises resource is automatically configured to use the updated Primary connection string.

trans-unit.source: Use Group Policy to control the on-premises resources used by a Hybrid Connection
trans-unit.target: Use Group Policy to control the on-premises resources used by a Hybrid Connection

trans-unit.source: Download the [Hybrid Connection Manager Administrative Templates](http://www.microsoft.com/download/details.aspx?id=42963).
trans-unit.target: Download the [Hybrid Connection Manager Administrative Templates](http://www.microsoft.com/download/details.aspx?id=42963).

trans-unit.source: Extract the files.
trans-unit.target: Extract the files.

trans-unit.source: On the computer that modifies group policy, do the following:
trans-unit.target: On the computer that modifies group policy, do the following:

trans-unit.source: Copy the .ADMX files to the *%WINROOT%\PolicyDefinitions* folder.
trans-unit.target: Copy the .ADMX files to the *%WINROOT%\PolicyDefinitions* folder.

trans-unit.source: Copy the .ADML files to the *%WINROOT%\PolicyDefinitions\en-us* folder.
trans-unit.target: Copy the .ADML files to the *%WINROOT%\PolicyDefinitions\en-us* folder.

trans-unit.source: Once copied, you can use Group Policy Editor to change the policy.
trans-unit.target: Once copied, you can use Group Policy Editor to change the policy.

trans-unit.target: Next
